message: a hypothetical question: What do we exactly need to have something like Stripe or Braintree in Egypt?

data.message: Islam elaborate? Which part of regulations need fixing?

1- Government approval. Egyptian government wants to see how the money is moving.
2- Users trust
3- Low ARPU. Compared to the Gulf, which has a higher ARPU

Amr Sobhy, as an example look at this document, it states the rules banks should comply with in order to provide Internet banking, it was released 6 months ago!
http://www.cbe.org.eg/NR/rdonlyres/C25AEE62-4909-43B8-883A-09ABEEE3FFC7/2636/CBEInternetBankingRegulationIssuedNov92016.pdf

Look at item number 3-1 for instance, banks require the WRITTEN signature for every new account opened. Imagine the scalability of this.

I know Stripe and Braintree aren't banks they are payment gatways, but any business dealing with money in Egypt is required to be affiliated with a bank I guess (i.e. mobile payments took years to be approved by the central bank and every operator have to have a bank affiliated with the service)

I mean look at the mentality issuing the regulations and look how it took them ages to regulate PayPal or mobile payments.

I can't imagine how they can handle Bitcoin. :D
Merchant Bank account from which you get API from Cards providers for implementation
